definition: to fasten/to button/button/buckle/knot/to arrest/to confiscate/to deduct (money)/discount/to knock/to smash, spike or dunk (a ball)/to cover (with a bowl etc)/(fig.) to tag a label on sb/(Tw) (loanword) code

sentences.english: He started to unbutton his pants.
sentences.chinese: 他开始解裤子上的纽扣。
不扣衣领最上面的纽扣。

sentences.english: Zip and button fastening. Curved waistband with belt loops.
sentences.chinese: 拉链和纽扣固定，腰带带有带环。

sentences.english: He buttoned the top button of his shirt.
sentences.chinese: 他把衬衣最上面一颗纽扣扣起来。

sentences.english: The blouse Niu that unties her buttons up, will her sleep the position that the skirt pulls Gao Dao's loins.
sentences.chinese: 解开她的上衣纽扣，将她的睡裙拉高到腰部的位置。

sentences.english: But my wife wants a gold chain, and I want a pair of silver buckles .
sentences.chinese: 但我的太太要一条金项链，我也要一对银纽扣。

sentences.english: Her attendants will also carry flowers and the groom and his attendants will wear boutonnieres.
sentences.chinese: 新郎和他的伴郎则在纽扣孔上插着花。

sentences.english: This coat buttons in the front.
sentences.chinese: 这件外衣是前面扣纽扣的。

sentences.english: That coat of mine buttons but this one zips.
sentences.chinese: 我的那件外衣装有纽扣，而这件有拉链。

sentences.english: "Unbutton my blouse and take it off, " she said.
sentences.chinese: “解开我的衬衣的纽扣，脱下它”，他说。

sentences.english: The buttons on my coat came unfastened.
My flower, seek not thy paradise in a fool’s buttonhole.
sentences.chinese: 我的芳花啊，不要在愚者的纽扣洞里觅求你的天堂。

sentences.english: A  brooch fixed to the collar matched her diamond- studded  sapphire button earrings.
sentences.chinese: 领口一只别针，与碎钻镶蓝宝石的‘纽扣’耳环成套。

sentences.english: If the suit is unbuttoned, where should be the stickpin ?
sentences.chinese: 西装敞着穿时，领带夹应在衬衫的那两颗纽扣之间？

sentences.english: Few people wear double-breasted suits nowadays.
sentences.chinese: 如今很少有人穿双排纽扣西装。

definition: variant of 紐扣|纽扣[niu3 kou4]
a buckle or fastener for clothing that does not use a button and buttonhole (e.g. the buckle on metal wristwatches)
collar/neckband/neckline/the place where the two ends of a collar meet
hidden snap fastener (concealed behind a flap on a garment)
